name: 黃如瑩
objective: The purpose of this course is to guide our students to explore their interested field, to look for possible critical approaches, to locate intriguing issues, to map out the various aspects pertaining to the discussions on certain topic, and to work out an inchoate proposal for the future research paper. In the end of the course, every student should hand in a tentative proposal for the future project.
schedule:
Unit One: Using research resources

Unit Two: Searching for target field

Unit Three: Choosing a topic from the main text

Unit Four: Exploring applicable critical approaches

Unit Five: Working on an outline for the research

Unit Six: Writing the draft for the proposal of future research project
scorePolicy:
1. Participation and discussions in classroom meetings:40%
2. Final project: research outcome and chosen topic for the thesis 20%
3. Weekly homework: 40%
materials:
1. Writing Research Papers:  A Norton Guide. 4th Edition. By Melissa Walker. new York: Norton. 1997.
2. Handbooks on MLA and APA Writing Styles.
remarks: We will set up a LINE group to conduct communication and online classes.
